sections.instructions: Write ONE WORD AND/OR A NUMBER for each answer.
sections.title: Copying photos to digital format

questions.question: Photos must not be in a ____ or an album.
The cost for 360 photos is ____ £ (including one disk).
Before the completed order is sent, ____ is required.
Photos can be placed in a folder, e.g. with the name ____.
The ____ and contrast can be improved if necessary.
Photos which are very fragile will be scanned by ____.
It may be possible to remove an object from a photo, or change the ____.
A photo which is not correctly in ____ cannot be fixed.
Orders are completed within ____.
Send the photos in a box (not ____).

sections.instructions: Questions 11–15: Choose the correct letter A, B or C. Questions 16–18: Choose THREE letters A–D. Questions 19–20: Choose TWO letters A–E.
sections.title: School changes

questions.question: Dartfield House school used to be
What is planned with regard to the lower school?
options: A All buildings on the main site will be improved.
B The lower school site will be used for new homes.
C Additional school buildings will be constructed on the lower school site.

questions.question: The catering has been changed because of
options: B changes to the school timetable.

questions.question: Parents are asked to
options: A help their children to decide in advance which serving point to use.
B make sure their children have enough money for food.
C advise their children on healthy food to eat.

questions.question: What does the speaker say about the existing canteen?
options: A Food will still be served there.
B Only staff will have access to it.
C Pupils can take their food into it.

questions.question: World Adventures
Street Life
Speedy Italian
Which TWO optional after-school lessons are new?

sections.instructions: Questions 21–24: Choose the correct letter A, B or C. Questions 25–30: Write ONE WORD ONLY.
sections.title: Assignment on sleep and dreams

questions.question: Luke read that one reason why we often forget dreams is that
options: A our memories cannot cope with too much information.
B we might otherwise be confused about what is real.
C we do not think they are important.

questions.question: What do Luke and Susie agree about dreams predicting the future?
options: A It may just be due to chance.
B It only happens with certain types of event.
C It happens more often than some people think.

questions.question: Susie says that a study on pre-school children having a short nap in the day
options: C failed to reach any clear conclusions.

questions.question: In their last assignment, both students had problems with
Twelve students from the ____ department.
Answers on ____.
Check ethical guidelines for working with ____.
Ensure that risk is assessed and ____ is kept to a minimum.
Calculate the correlation and make a ____.
____ the research.

sections.instructions: Write ONE WORD ONLY for each answer.
sections.title: Health benefits of dance

questions.question: An experiment on university students suggested that dance increases ____.
For those with mental illness, dance could be used as a form of ____.
accessible for people with low levels of ____.
better ____ reduces the risk of accidents.
improves ____ function by making it work faster.
gives people more ____ to take exercise.
can lessen the feeling of ____.
doing Zumba for 40 minutes uses up as many ____ as other quite intense forms of exercise.
women suffering from ____ benefited from doing Zumba.
Zumba became a ____ for the participants.
